Class Customer

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.bookingsystem.model.Customer
public class Customer extends Object
Represents a customer in the flight booking system. A customer has an ID, name, phone number, email, age, gender, preferred meal type, and a list of bookings. Customers can also be marked as deleted.

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      public Customer(int id, String name, String phone, String email, int age, String gender, MealType preferredMealType)
      Constructs a new Customer object with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the customer.
      name - The name of the customer.
      phone - The phone number of the customer.
      email - The email address of the customer.
      age - The age of the customer.
      gender - The gender of the customer.
      preferredMealType - The preferred meal type of the customer.

    • getDetailsShort

      public String getDetailsShort()
      Returns a short string representation of the customer's details. Example: 1: Alice Wonderland (111222333, alice@example.com, 30, Female, Pref: Vegetarian)
      Returns:
      A short string containing the customer's ID, name, phone, email, age, gender, and preferred meal type.

    • getDetailsLong

      public String getDetailsLong()
      Returns a long string representation of the customer's details, including their bookings.
      Returns:
      A detailed string containing the customer's ID, name, phone, email, age, gender, preferred meal type, and details of their associated bookings.

    • cancelBookingForFlight

      public void cancelBookingForFlight(int flightId)
      Cancels a booking associated with a specific flight for this customer. This method removes the booking if either the outbound or return flight matches the given flight ID.
      Parameters:
      flightId - The ID of the flight for which to cancel the booking.

    • hasBookingForFlight

      public boolean hasBookingForFlight(Flight flight)
      Checks if the customer has a booking for a given flight.
      Parameters:
      flight - The flight to check for a booking.
      Returns:
      true if the customer has a booking for the specified flight (either as an outbound or return flight), false otherwise.

      public String toString()
